topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5532dcb5636872687a7b0700#post_5532dcb5636872687a7b0700
*THE PLACE WHERE I USED TO LIVE HAS TURNED INTO CRIME CENTRAL*

People are being killed there like every Week almost! And cops have to be out over there 24-7 now!

Its so bad people are marching down the streets telling people to stop the killing!

My mom just told me that on the news they were talking about how recently these people were holding Dog fights and this one Female Pitbull didn't want to fight right?

So you know what they did to it? They took the poor dog and bound it to a train track where it couldn't even move and SHOT IT THREE TIMES.

And do you know this dog didn't die? The cops saved it and it had to get its leg amputated. 

*The place where I grew up has turned into hell's kitchen*

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5532ddf66368725bf9b21300#post_5532ddf66368725bf9b21300
I know I sound like a broken record, but I am totally calling it that monster girls and such are going to become as popular as nekos.

Why?  Cause it's super easy to gauge how popular something is going to be from the popularity backlash in that the more popularity backlash there is from something you know it's going to become popular.

The popularity backlash from monster girls almost directly mirrors the popularity backlash of when nekos first came onto the scene and not only that but monster girl popularity while still considerably smaller is still comparable to neko.

To further expand upon this when nekos first showed up it was a quick way to earn money because it was something new and interesting so as a result any show that had any neko characters received a definitive popularity and monetary boost, but fast forward today it's reached the point at which popularity wise it's actually considered the norm for at least one neko character or such to be in fantasy style anime or such.

When monster musume gets it's anime it's completely fair to say that because the number of monster girls in anime currently is disproportionately low to how popular it is that it will receive a disproportionately high number of views even among people that have never been interested in the franchise will watch it.  This will in turn cause other companies to create their shows with monster girls and such thus giving rise to their widespread adoption in anime.




Essentially: monster girls are becoming popular, but they don't get nearly any tread in anime.  When monster musume airs it will probably be in the top 5 most watched anime for 2015; other companies will introduce monster girls or create their own anime about monster girls as such to try to cash out as well.


Tl:dr; in 2 years monster girls will be as popular as and in as many shows as neko.
